vote.title: Authorize (1) the acceptance of a Continuum of Care (“CoC”) Grant (Grant No. TX0072L6T002013, CFDA No. 14.267) from the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (“HUD”) for the City of Dallas’ Shelter Plus Care Project (“Project”) in the amount of $1,025,974.00, to provide permanent housing and supportive services for homeless persons with disabilities for the period October 1, 2021 through September 30, 2022; (2) the establishment of appropriations in an amount not to exceed $1,025,974.00 in the FY 20 CoC Grant-Shelter Plus Care-PSH FY 22 Fund; (3) the receipt and deposit of grant funds as reimbursement from HUD in an amount not to exceed $1,025,974.00 in the FY 20 CoC Grant-Shelter Plus Care-PSH FY 22 Fund; (4) a local cash match from the City of Dallas in the amount of $256,494.00; and (5) execution of any and all documents required for the grant agreement - Total not to exceed $1,282,468.00 - Financing:  U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development Grant Funds ($1,025,974.00) and General Fund ($256,494.00) (subject to appropriation)
vote.description: Authorize (1) the acceptance of a Continuum of Care (“CoC”) Grant (Grant No. TX0072L6T002013, CFDA No. 14.267) from the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (“HUD”) for the City of Dallas’ Shelter Plus Care Project (“Project”) in the amount of $1,025,974.00, to provide permanent housing and supportive services for homeless persons with disabilities for the period October 1, 2021 through September 30, 2022; (2) the establishment of appropriations in an amount not to exceed $1,025,974.00 in the FY 20 CoC Grant-Shelter Plus Care-PSH FY 22 Fund; (3) the receipt and deposit of grant funds as reimbursement from HUD in an amount not to exceed $1,025,974.00 in the FY 20 CoC Grant-Shelter Plus Care-PSH FY 22 Fund; (4) a local cash match from the City of Dallas in the amount of $256,494.00; and (5) execution of any and all documents required for the grant agreement - Total not to exceed $1,282,468.00 - Financing:  U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development Grant Funds ($1,025,974.00) and General Fund ($256,494.00) (subject to appropriation)
